apis.description: Session management: create, login user and delete sessions

operations.summary: Create session and optionally login a user
operations.notes:
Use this API to generate a token, which is required when calling other QuickBlox apis. Tokens are valid for 2 hours, after which you will need to generate a new token. Calling the API with just the required parameters means you will be issued with an API Application token. If you also provide valid sign-in details you will obtain an API User token, which enables your app to access and modify the content owned by that user.
Alternatively you can generate a valid token by creating calling the login api.
See API_Session_Creation documentation for more information and sample curl requests.

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.description:
The autogenerated unique identifier of your app.
You can get this value from the admin console of your quickblox account

parameters.name: auth_key
parameters.description:
The authentication key associated with the app.
You can get this value from the Admin console of your quickblox account

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The current UTC time formatted as a unix timestamp. Needs to be accurate to within 10 minutes of NTP time

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A number used to identify the request, the combination of timestamp and nonce must be unique. See Cryptographic nonce on Wikipedia

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description:
This is a SHA-1 hash of the request generated using the app's authorization secret.
The authorization secret can be found in the admin console of your quickblox account

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: List of permisions required by the app to social networking platforms. See Facebook login permissions reference

parameters.name: keys[token]
parameters.description: Your app's access token for the social network platform

parameters.name: keys[secret]
parameters.description: Your app's access token secret for the social network platform (currently only required for Twitter integration)

operations.notes: Calling this method will remove and invalidate the token.
